trans-unit.source: Install your StorSimple 8600 device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Install your StorSimple 8600 device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to unpack, rack mount, and cable your StorSimple 8600 device before you deploy and configure the software.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to unpack, rack mount, and cable your StorSimple 8600 device before you deploy and configure the software.

trans-unit.source: Your Microsoft Azure StorSimple 8600 is a dual enclosure device and consists of a primary and an EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Your Microsoft Azure StorSimple 8600 is a dual enclosure device and consists of a primary and an EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to unpack, rack-mount, and cable the StorSimple 8600 device hardware before you configure the StorSimple software.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to unpack, rack-mount, and cable the StorSimple 8600 device hardware before you configure the StorSimple software.

trans-unit.source: The following steps provide clear, detailed instructions on how to unpack your StorSimple 8600 storage device.
trans-unit.target: The following steps provide clear, detailed instructions on how to unpack your StorSimple 8600 storage device.

trans-unit.source: This device is shipped in two separate boxes, one for the primary enclosure and another for the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: This device is shipped in two separate boxes, one for the primary enclosure and another for the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Before you unpack your device, review the following information.
trans-unit.target: Before you unpack your device, review the following information.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>heavy weight icon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>heavy weight icon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight of the device if you are handling it manually.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight of the device if you are handling it manually.

trans-unit.source: A fully configured device can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).
trans-unit.target: A fully configured device can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).

trans-unit.source: Place the box on a flat, level surface.
trans-unit.target: Place the box on a flat, level surface.

trans-unit.source: Next, complete the following steps to unpack your device.
trans-unit.target: Next, complete the following steps to unpack your device.

trans-unit.source: Inspect the boxes and the packaging foam for crushes, cuts, water damage, or any other obvious damage.
trans-unit.target: Inspect the boxes and the packaging foam for crushes, cuts, water damage, or any other obvious damage.

trans-unit.source: If the box or packaging is severely damaged, do not open the box.
trans-unit.target: If the box or packaging is severely damaged, do not open the box.

trans-unit.source: Please contact Microsoft Support to help you assess whether the device is in good working order.
trans-unit.target: Please contact Microsoft Support to help you assess whether the device is in good working order.

trans-unit.source: Open the two boxes and unpack the primary and EBOD enclosures.
trans-unit.target: Open the two boxes and unpack the primary and EBOD enclosures.

trans-unit.source: The following figure shows the unpacked view of your storage device.
trans-unit.target: The following figure shows the unpacked view of your storage device.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Unpack your storage device</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Unpack your storage device</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Unpacked view of your storage device
trans-unit.target: Unpacked view of your storage device

trans-unit.source: Label | Description ----- | ------------- 1 | Packing box 2 | SAS cables (in accessories and cables tray) 3 | Bottom foam 4 | Device 5 | Top foam 6 | Accessory box
trans-unit.target: Label | Description ----- | ------------- 1 | Packing box 2 | SAS cables (in accessories and cables tray) 3 | Bottom foam 4 | Device 5 | Top foam 6 | Accessory box

trans-unit.source: After unpacking the two boxes, make sure that you have:
trans-unit.target: After unpacking the two boxes, make sure that you have:

trans-unit.source: 1 primary enclosure (the primary enclosure and EBOD enclosure are in two separate boxes)
trans-unit.target: 1 primary enclosure (the primary enclosure and EBOD enclosure are in two separate boxes)

trans-unit.source: 1 EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: 1 EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: 4 power cords, 2 in each box
trans-unit.target: 4 power cords, 2 in each box

trans-unit.source: 2 SAS cables (to connect the primary enclosure to EBOD enclosure)
trans-unit.target: 2 SAS cables (to connect the primary enclosure to EBOD enclosure)

trans-unit.source: 1 crossover Ethernet cable
trans-unit.target: 1 crossover Ethernet cable

trans-unit.source: 2 serial console cables
trans-unit.target: 2 serial console cables

trans-unit.source: 1 serial-USB converter for serial access
trans-unit.target: 1 serial-USB converter for serial access

trans-unit.source: 4 single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters for use with 10 GbE network interfaces
trans-unit.target: 4 single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters for use with 10 GbE network interfaces

trans-unit.source: 2 rack mount kits (4 side rails with mounting hardware, 2 each for the primary enclosure and EBOD enclosure), 1 in each box
trans-unit.target: 2 rack mount kits (4 side rails with mounting hardware, 2 each for the primary enclosure and EBOD enclosure), 1 in each box

trans-unit.source: Getting started documentation
trans-unit.target: Getting started documentation

trans-unit.source: If you did not receive any of the items listed above, contact Microsoft Support.
trans-unit.target: If you did not receive any of the items listed above, contact Microsoft Support.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to rack-mount your device.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to rack-mount your device.

trans-unit.source: Follow the next steps to install your StorSimple 8600 storage device in a standard 19-inch rack with front and rear posts.
trans-unit.target: Follow the next steps to install your StorSimple 8600 storage device in a standard 19-inch rack with front and rear posts.

trans-unit.source: This device comes with two enclosures: a primary enclosure and an EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: This device comes with two enclosures: a primary enclosure and an EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Both of these need to be rack-mounted.
trans-unit.target: Both of these need to be rack-mounted.

trans-unit.source: The installation consists of multiple steps, each of which is discussed in the following procedures.
trans-unit.target: The installation consists of multiple steps, each of which is discussed in the following procedures.

trans-unit.source: The enclosures must be installed in a standard 19-inch rack that has both front and rear posts.
trans-unit.target: The enclosures must be installed in a standard 19-inch rack that has both front and rear posts.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to prepare for rack installation.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to prepare for rack installation.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the primary and EBOD enclosures are resting safely on a flat, stable, and level work surface (or similar).
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the primary and EBOD enclosures are resting safely on a flat, stable, and level work surface (or similar).

trans-unit.source: Verify that the site where you intend to set up has standard AC power from an independent source or a rack Power Distribution Unit (PDU) with an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).
trans-unit.target: Verify that the site where you intend to set up has standard AC power from an independent source or a rack Power Distribution Unit (PDU) with an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).

trans-unit.source: Make sure that one 4U (2 X 2U) slot is available on the rack in which you intend to mount the enclosures.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that one 4U (2 X 2U) slot is available on the rack in which you intend to mount the enclosures.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>heavy weight icon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>heavy weight icon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight if you are handling the device setup manually.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight if you are handling the device setup manually.

trans-unit.source: A fully configured enclosure can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).
trans-unit.target: A fully configured enclosure can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).

trans-unit.source: The enclosures are designed for installation in a standard 19-inch rack cabinet with:
trans-unit.target: The enclosures are designed for installation in a standard 19-inch rack cabinet with:

trans-unit.source: Minimum depth of 27.84 inches from rack post to post
trans-unit.target: Minimum depth of 27.84 inches from rack post to post

trans-unit.source: Maximum weight of 32 kg for the device
trans-unit.target: Maximum weight of 32 kg for the device

trans-unit.source: Maximum back pressure of 5 Pascal (0.5 mm water gauge)
trans-unit.target: Maximum back pressure of 5 Pascal (0.5 mm water gauge)

trans-unit.source: A set of mounting rails will be provided for use with the 19-inch rack cabinet.
trans-unit.target: A set of mounting rails will be provided for use with the 19-inch rack cabinet.

trans-unit.source: The rails have been tested to handle the maximum enclosure weight.
trans-unit.target: The rails have been tested to handle the maximum enclosure weight.

trans-unit.source: These rails will also allow installation of multiple enclosures without loss of space within the rack.
trans-unit.target: These rails will also allow installation of multiple enclosures without loss of space within the rack.

trans-unit.source: Install the EBOD enclosure first.
trans-unit.target: Install the EBOD enclosure first.

trans-unit.source: With the enclosure on the work surface, remove the left and right front flange caps by pulling the caps free.
trans-unit.target: With the enclosure on the work surface, remove the left and right front flange caps by pulling the caps free.

trans-unit.source: The flange caps simply snap onto the flanges.
trans-unit.target: The flange caps simply snap onto the flanges.

trans-unit.source: Typically, these rails are installed at the factory.
trans-unit.target: Typically, these rails are installed at the factory.

trans-unit.source: If they are not, then install the left-rail and right-rail slides to the sides of the enclosure chassis.
trans-unit.target: If they are not, then install the left-rail and right-rail slides to the sides of the enclosure chassis.

trans-unit.source: They attach using six metric screws on each side.
trans-unit.target: They attach using six metric screws on each side.

trans-unit.source: To help with orientation, the rail slides are marked LH – Front and RH – Front, and the end that is affixed towards the rear of the enclosure has a tapered end.
trans-unit.target: To help with orientation, the rail slides are marked LH – Front and RH – Front, and the end that is affixed towards the rear of the enclosure has a tapered end.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attaching rail slides to enclosure chassis</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attaching rail slides to enclosure chassis</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Attaching rail slides to the sides of the enclosure
trans-unit.target: Attaching rail slides to the sides of the enclosure

trans-unit.source: Label | Description ----- | ----------- 1 | M 3x4 button-head screws 2 | Chassis slides
trans-unit.target: Label | Description ----- | ----------- 1 | M 3x4 button-head screws 2 | Chassis slides

trans-unit.source: Attach the left rail and right rail assemblies to the rack cabinet vertical members.
trans-unit.target: Attach the left rail and right rail assemblies to the rack cabinet vertical members.

trans-unit.source: The brackets are marked LH, RH, and This side up to guide you through correct orientation.
trans-unit.target: The brackets are marked LH, RH, and This side up to guide you through correct orientation.

trans-unit.source: Locate the rail pins at the front and rear of the rail assembly.
trans-unit.target: Locate the rail pins at the front and rear of the rail assembly.

trans-unit.source: Extend the rail to fit between the rack posts and insert the pins into the front and rear-rack post vertical member holes.
trans-unit.target: Extend the rail to fit between the rack posts and insert the pins into the front and rear-rack post vertical member holes.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that the rail assembly is level.
trans-unit.target: Be sure that the rail assembly is level.

trans-unit.source: Secure the rail assembly to the rack vertical members by using two of the metric screws provided.
trans-unit.target: Secure the rail assembly to the rack vertical members by using two of the metric screws provided.

trans-unit.source: Use one screw on the front and one on the rear.
trans-unit.target: Use one screw on the front and one on the rear.

trans-unit.source: Repeat these steps for the other rail assembly.
trans-unit.target: Repeat these steps for the other rail assembly.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attaching rail slides to rack cabinet</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attaching rail slides to rack cabinet</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Attaching rail assemblies to the rack
trans-unit.target: Attaching rail assemblies to the rack

trans-unit.source: Label | Description ----- | ----------- 1 | Clamping screw 2 | Square-hole front rack post screw 3 | Left front-rail location pins 4 | Clamping screw 5 | Right front-rail location pins
trans-unit.target: Label | Description ----- | ----------- 1 | Clamping screw 2 | Square-hole front rack post screw 3 | Left front-rail location pins 4 | Clamping screw 5 | Right front-rail location pins

trans-unit.source: Using the rack rails that were just installed, perform the following steps to mount the EBOD enclosure in the rack.
trans-unit.target: Using the rack rails that were just installed, perform the following steps to mount the EBOD enclosure in the rack.

trans-unit.source: With an assistant, lift the enclosure and align it with the rack rails.
trans-unit.target: With an assistant, lift the enclosure and align it with the rack rails.

trans-unit.source: Carefully insert the enclosure into the rails, and then push it completely into the rack cabinet.
trans-unit.target: Carefully insert the enclosure into the rails, and then push it completely into the rack cabinet.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Inserting device in the rack</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Inserting device in the rack</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Mounting the enclosure in the rack
trans-unit.target: Mounting the enclosure in the rack

trans-unit.source: Secure the enclosure into the rack by installing one provided Phillips-head screw through each flange, left and right.
trans-unit.target: Secure the enclosure into the rack by installing one provided Phillips-head screw through each flange, left and right.

trans-unit.source: Install the flange caps by pressing them into position and snapping them into place.
trans-unit.target: Install the flange caps by pressing them into position and snapping them into place.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Installing flange caps</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Installing flange caps</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Installing the flange caps
trans-unit.target: Installing the flange caps

trans-unit.source: Label | Description ----- | ----------- 1 | Enclosure fastening screw
trans-unit.target: Label | Description ----- | ----------- 1 | Enclosure fastening screw

trans-unit.source: After you have finished mounting the EBOD enclosure, you will need to mount the primary enclosure following the same steps.
trans-unit.target: After you have finished mounting the EBOD enclosure, you will need to mount the primary enclosure following the same steps.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to have a few empty slots in the rack between the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to have a few empty slots in the rack between the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Use the provided 2m SAS cable to connect the primary enclosure to the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Use the provided 2m SAS cable to connect the primary enclosure to the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: There are no constraints on the relative placement of the head unit to the EBOD unit.
trans-unit.target: There are no constraints on the relative placement of the head unit to the EBOD unit.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the primary enclosure can be placed in the top slot and the EBOD enclosure below — or vice versa.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the primary enclosure can be placed in the top slot and the EBOD enclosure below — or vice versa.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to cable your device for power, network, and serial access.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to cable your device for power, network, and serial access.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures explain how to cable your StorSimple 8600 device for power, network, and serial connections.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures explain how to cable your StorSimple 8600 device for power, network, and serial connections.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin to cable your device, you will need:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin to cable your device, you will need:

trans-unit.source: Your primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure, completely unpacked
trans-unit.target: Your primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure, completely unpacked

trans-unit.source: 4 power cables (2 each for the primary and the EBOD enclosure) that came with your device
trans-unit.target: 4 power cables (2 each for the primary and the EBOD enclosure) that came with your device

trans-unit.source: 2 SAS cables supplied with the device to connect the EBOD enclosure to the primary enclosure
trans-unit.target: 2 SAS cables supplied with the device to connect the EBOD enclosure to the primary enclosure

trans-unit.source: Access to 2 Power Distribution Units (PDUs) (recommended)
trans-unit.target: Access to 2 Power Distribution Units (PDUs) (recommended)

trans-unit.source: Network cables
trans-unit.target: Network cables

trans-unit.source: Provided serial cables
trans-unit.target: Provided serial cables

trans-unit.source: Serial-USB converter with the appropriate driver installed on your PC (if needed)
trans-unit.target: Serial-USB converter with the appropriate driver installed on your PC (if needed)

trans-unit.source: Provided single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters for use with 10 GbE network interfaces
trans-unit.target: Provided single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters for use with 10 GbE network interfaces

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Supported hardware for 10 GbE network interfaces on your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Supported hardware for 10 GbE network interfaces on your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Your device has both a primary enclosure and an EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Your device has both a primary enclosure and an EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: This requires the units to be cabled together for Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) connectivity and power.
trans-unit.target: This requires the units to be cabled together for Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) connectivity and power.

trans-unit.source: When setting up this device for the first time, perform the steps for SAS cabling first and then complete the steps for power cabling.
trans-unit.target: When setting up this device for the first time, perform the steps for SAS cabling first and then complete the steps for power cabling.

trans-unit.source: Your device is in an active-standby configuration: at any given time, one controller module is active and processing all disk and network operations while the other controller module is on standby.
trans-unit.target: Your device is in an active-standby configuration: at any given time, one controller module is active and processing all disk and network operations while the other controller module is on standby.

trans-unit.source: If a controller failure occurs, the standby controller immediately activates and continues all the disk and networking operations.
trans-unit.target: If a controller failure occurs, the standby controller immediately activates and continues all the disk and networking operations.

trans-unit.source: To support this redundant controller failover, you need to cable your device network as shown in the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To support this redundant controller failover, you need to cable your device network as shown in the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Your device has six network interfaces on each controller: four 1 Gbps and two 10 Gbps Ethernet ports.
trans-unit.target: Your device has six network interfaces on each controller: four 1 Gbps and two 10 Gbps Ethernet ports.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the following illustration to identify the data ports on the backplane of your device.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the following illustration to identify the data ports on the backplane of your device.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backplane of 8600 device</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backplane of 8600 device</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Back of your device showing the data ports
trans-unit.target: Back of your device showing the data ports

trans-unit.source: Label | Description ------- | ----------- 0,1,4,5 | 1 GbE network interfaces 2,3 | 10 GbE network interfaces 6 | Serial ports
trans-unit.target: Label | Description ------- | ----------- 0,1,4,5 | 1 GbE network interfaces 2,3 | 10 GbE network interfaces 6 | Serial ports

trans-unit.source: For high availability, the device requires a minimum of two connections for each controller.
trans-unit.target: For high availability, the device requires a minimum of two connections for each controller.

trans-unit.source: The DATA 0 port is automatically enabled and configured via the serial console of the device.
trans-unit.target: The DATA 0 port is automatically enabled and configured via the serial console of the device.

trans-unit.source: Apart from DATA 0, another data port also needs to be configured through the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Apart from DATA 0, another data port also needs to be configured through the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Identify identical network interfaces on each controller.
trans-unit.target: Identify identical network interfaces on each controller.

trans-unit.source: For instance, if you choose to connect DATA 0 and DATA 3 for one of the controllers, you need to connect the corresponding DATA 0 and DATA 3 on the other controller.
trans-unit.target: For instance, if you choose to connect DATA 0 and DATA 3 for one of the controllers, you need to connect the corresponding DATA 0 and DATA 3 on the other controller.

trans-unit.source: For high availability, ensure that you connect:
trans-unit.target: For high availability, ensure that you connect:

trans-unit.source: Identical interfaces on each controller to the relevant network to ensure availability through a controller failure.
trans-unit.target: Identical interfaces on each controller to the relevant network to ensure availability through a controller failure.

trans-unit.source: Interfaces from each controller to at least two different switches to ensure availability through a switch failure.
trans-unit.target: Interfaces from each controller to at least two different switches to ensure availability through a switch failure.

trans-unit.source: DATA 0 port to the primary LAN (network with Internet access).
trans-unit.target: DATA 0 port to the primary LAN (network with Internet access).

trans-unit.source: The other data ports can be connected to SAN/iSCSI LAN (VLAN) segment of the network, depending on the intended role.
trans-unit.target: The other data ports can be connected to SAN/iSCSI LAN (VLAN) segment of the network, depending on the intended role.

trans-unit.source: At a minimum, configure one network interface for cloud access and one for iSCSI.
trans-unit.target: At a minimum, configure one network interface for cloud access and one for iSCSI.

trans-unit.source: For high availability and performance, configure two pairs of network interfaces on each controller.
trans-unit.target: For high availability and performance, configure two pairs of network interfaces on each controller.

trans-unit.source: See the following diagram for network cabling.
trans-unit.target: See the following diagram for network cabling.

trans-unit.source: (The minimum network configuration is shown by solid blue lines.
trans-unit.target: (The minimum network configuration is shown by solid blue lines.

trans-unit.source: For high availability and performance, additional configuration required is shown by dotted lines.)
trans-unit.target: For high availability and performance, additional configuration required is shown by dotted lines.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cable your 4U device for network</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cable your 4U device for network</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Network cabling for your device
trans-unit.target: Network cabling for your device

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A
trans-unit.target: A

trans-unit.source: LAN with Internet access
trans-unit.target: LAN with Internet access

trans-unit.source: B
trans-unit.target: B

trans-unit.source: Controller 0
trans-unit.target: Controller 0

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: PCM 0
trans-unit.target: PCM 0

trans-unit.source: D
trans-unit.target: D

trans-unit.source: Controller 1
trans-unit.target: Controller 1

trans-unit.source: E
trans-unit.target: E

trans-unit.source: PCM 1
trans-unit.target: PCM 1

trans-unit.source: F
trans-unit.target: F

trans-unit.source: EBOD controller 0
trans-unit.target: EBOD controller 0

trans-unit.source: G
trans-unit.target: G

trans-unit.source: EBOD controller 1
trans-unit.target: EBOD controller 1

trans-unit.source: H,I
trans-unit.target: H,I

trans-unit.source: Hosts (for example, file servers)
trans-unit.target: Hosts (for example, file servers)

trans-unit.source: Network interfaces
trans-unit.target: Network interfaces

trans-unit.source: Primary enclosure
trans-unit.target: Primary enclosure

trans-unit.source: EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to cable your serial port.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to cable your serial port.

trans-unit.source: Your device has a serial port on each controller that is identified by a wrench icon.
trans-unit.target: Your device has a serial port on each controller that is identified by a wrench icon.

trans-unit.source: To locate the serial ports, refer to the illustration that shows the data ports on the back of your device.
trans-unit.target: To locate the serial ports, refer to the illustration that shows the data ports on the back of your device.

trans-unit.source: Identify the active controller on your device backplane.
trans-unit.target: Identify the active controller on your device backplane.

trans-unit.source: A blinking blue LED indicates that the controller is active.
trans-unit.target: A blinking blue LED indicates that the controller is active.

trans-unit.source: Use the provided serial cable (if needed, the USB-serial converter for your laptop), and connect your console or computer (with terminal emulation to the device) to the serial port of the active controller.
trans-unit.target: Use the provided serial cable (if needed, the USB-serial converter for your laptop), and connect your console or computer (with terminal emulation to the device) to the serial port of the active controller.

trans-unit.source: Install the serial-USB drivers (shipped with the device) on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Install the serial-USB drivers (shipped with the device) on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Set up the serial connection as follows:
trans-unit.target: Set up the serial connection as follows:

trans-unit.source: 8 data bits
trans-unit.target: 8 data bits

trans-unit.source: 1 stop bit
trans-unit.target: 1 stop bit

trans-unit.source: No parity
trans-unit.target: No parity

trans-unit.source: Flow control set to None
trans-unit.target: Flow control set to None

trans-unit.source: Verify that the connection is working by pressing Enter on the console.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the connection is working by pressing Enter on the console.

trans-unit.source: A serial console menu should appear.
trans-unit.target: A serial console menu should appear.

trans-unit.source: Lights-Out Management: When the device is installed in a remote datacenter or in a computer room with limited access, ensure that the serial connections to both controllers are always connected to a serial console switch or similar equipment.
trans-unit.target: Lights-Out Management: When the device is installed in a remote datacenter or in a computer room with limited access, ensure that the serial connections to both controllers are always connected to a serial console switch or similar equipment.

trans-unit.source: This allows out-of-band remote control and support operations in case of network disruption or unexpected failures.
trans-unit.target: This allows out-of-band remote control and support operations in case of network disruption or unexpected failures.

trans-unit.source: You have completed cabling your device for power, network access, and serial connection.The next step is to configure the software on your device.
trans-unit.target: You have completed cabling your device for power, network access, and serial connection.The next step is to configure the software on your device.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to <linkText>deploy and configure your on-premises StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to <linkText>deploy and configure your on-premises StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>
